claims.object: Specifies from 0 till 100% how strongly a spatial relation holds

surface_layer.definition: A function that determines the degree to which a spatial relation is valid or applicable in a given context.

deep_layer.mechanism: Assigns a value between 0 and 100% to represent the strength or validity of a spatial relationship.
deep_layer.origin: Derived from mathematical functions and logical reasoning to quantify spatial relationships.

examples: A function that assigns a higher value when two objects are very close and a lower value when they are far apart.
A function that considers the orientation of objects to determine the strength of a directional relationship.
